long-term-strategy.original:
Migrate to newer PDF revisions when the PDF major version number changes (i.e. PDF 2.0) or to a format that shares the essential and distinguishing characteristics of the PDF 1.7 specification.
A normalized version will be created but not stored for all PDF 1.6 files upon ingestion. The format for this version, 'pdf_norm_1', will consist of a single XML file (the 'index' file) in METS format and separate 24-bit RGB 600dpi uncompressed TIFF 6.0 files for each page of the original PDF. The detailed specifications for the pdf_norm_1 format are described in a separate FDA publication (“Normalization for PDF 1.x Files: A Specification of the PDF_NORM_1 Format”) available on the Florida Digital Archive website.

short-term-actions.action: Continue to monitor and evaluate the suitability of PDF to PDF/A-1 conversion tool for PDF/A-1 to become the normalized format of PDF 1.6.

action-plan.note: This action plan is currently under discussion and is subject to change.
